headline: A face born Anew
description: An earlier psalm-text, later colored and transformed into an artwork where a face emerges unconsciously from the poem’s fragments. The visual form, with fiery oranges and purples, transforms the words into an archetypal visage. A Totem Current moment where subconscious shape surfaces from layered creation.
author: Aleksandr
whyItMatters: This work demonstrates how text can be both seed and vessel: an earlier psalm provided structure, but through coloring and layering it gave rise to a face—an archetype unplanned, surfacing as revelation. It captures the Totem Current principle of subconscious forms breaking through conscious creation.

motifMap.meaning: An emergent self formed from fractured lines of text and color
The emotional tension of shame, sorrow, and renewal transmuted into visual heat
Words that remain as bones of meaning within the larger visual body

articleExcerpt:
Deeper still—
To the Rot
Hands are bloody theirs and mine.
At the end I’ll be born anew.

sourceFragments.description: Original psalm-text written earlier, later overlaid with color.

associatedMedia.description: Final artwork with embedded psalm-text where a face emerges through coloring
